ticket.title: Undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request
ticket.original-body:
I'm seeing the following in the development logs when I perform a GET request:
@@@ Processing "/posts" to */* (for 127.0.0.1 at 2010-01-17 18:12:05) [GET]
NoMethodError (undefined method `adapter_name' for {:engine=>#<Arel::Sql::Engine:0x1b33188 @ar=ActiveRecord::Base>}:Hash): app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:5:in `index' @@@
In order to generate the my project, I performed the following steps:
@@@ $ rails blog-3.0.0 $ cd blog-3.0.0 $ script/generate scaffold post title:string blog:text $ rake db:migrate $ script/server @@@
Now, navigate to the URL, http:://localhost:3000/posts, and one should be able to see the above message in the 'development.log' file.
I have the following configuration:
@@@ OS: Mac OS 10.5.8 (PPC) ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-01-18 trunk 26340) [powerpc-darwin9.8.0] @@@
Lastly, my Gemfile contains the following:
@@@ gem "rails", "3.0.pre"
## Bundle edge rails: # gem "rails", :git => "git://github.com/rails/rails.git"
## Bundle the gems you use: gem "sqlite3-ruby", :require_as => "sqlite3" @@@

@@@ Processing "/posts" to */* (for 127.0.0.1 at 2010-01-17 18:12:05) [GET]

ticket.original-body-html:
I'm seeing the following in the development logs when I perform a GET request:

Processing "/posts" to */* (for 127.0.0.1 at 2010-01-17 18:12:05) [GET]

NoMethodError (undefined method `adapter_name' for {:engine=>#<Arel::Sql::Engine:0x1b33188 @ar=ActiveRecord::Base>}:Hash):
  app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:5:in `index'

In order to generate the my project, I performed the following steps:

$ rails blog-3.0.0
$ cd blog-3.0.0
$ script/generate scaffold post title:string blog:text
$ rake db:migrate
$ script/server

Now, navigate to the URL, http:://localhost:3000/posts, and one should be able to see the above message in the 'development.log' file.

I have the following configuration:

OS:  Mac OS 10.5.8 (PPC)
ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-01-18 trunk 26340) [powerpc-darwin9.8.0]

Lastly, my Gemfile contains the following:

gem "rails", "3.0.pre"

## Bundle edge rails:
# gem "rails", :git => "git://github.com/rails/rails.git"

## Bundle the gems you use:
gem "sqlite3-ruby", :require_as => "sqlite3"

version.body-html:
I'm seeing the following in the development logs when I perform a GET request:

Processing "/posts" to */* (for 127.0.0.1 at 2010-01-17 18:12:05) [GET]

NoMethodError (undefined method `adapter_name' for {:engine=>#<Arel::Sql::Engine:0x1b33188 @ar=ActiveRecord::Base>}:Hash):
  app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:5:in `index'

In order to generate the my project, I performed the following steps:

$ rails blog-3.0.0
$ cd blog-3.0.0
$ script/generate scaffold post title:string blog:text
$ rake db:migrate
$ script/server

Now, navigate to the URL, http:://localhost:3000/posts, and one should be able to see the above message in the 'development.log' file.

I have the following configuration:

OS:  Mac OS 10.5.8 (PPC)
ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-01-18 trunk 26340) [powerpc-darwin9.8.0]

Lastly, my Gemfile contains the following:

gem "rails", "3.0.pre"

## Bundle edge rails:
# gem "rails", :git => "git://github.com/rails/rails.git"

## Bundle the gems you use:
gem "sqlite3-ruby", :require_as => "sqlite3"
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body:
You'll need to follow the instructions posted here: http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/2010/1/1/getting-a-new-app-running-on-edge.
If you find that there is error afterwards, please reply by saying so. Thanks.
version.body-html:
You'll need to follow the instructions posted here: http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/2010/1/1/getting-a-new-app-running-on....

If you find that there is error afterwards, please reply by saying so. Thanks.
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body:
Rizwan, I seeing the same error in the logs after following steps as indicated here:
http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/2010/1/1/getting-a-new-app-running-on-edge
version.body-html:
Rizwan, I seeing the same error in the logs after following steps as indicated here:

http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/2010/1/1/getting-a-new-app-running-on...
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body:
Looks to be an issue with arel dependency. Adding this line to Gemfile in generated app root worked for me.
@@@ ruby gem 'arel', :git => 'git://github.com/rails/arel.git' @@@
version.body-html:
Looks to be an issue with arel dependency. Adding this line to Gemfile in generated app root worked for me.

  gem 'arel', :git => 'git://github.com/rails/arel.git'
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body: Yes, there's an issue with the dependency mechanism because the first line of the Gemfile bundles the arel gem with the application. Also, I confirmed that your solution does work within my environment.
version.body-html: Yes, there's an issue with the dependency mechanism because the first line of the Gemfile bundles the arel gem with the application. Also, I confirmed that your solution does work within my environment.
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body:
I'm having the same issue. I try to solve it adding the arel gem to the Gemfile and thats not work for me. http://localhost:3000/posts/new load correctly but when submiting form this error is shown:
undefined method `columns' for #<Hash:0x00000103243f98> app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:47:in `block in create' app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:46:in `create'
It seems not to get the sqlite3 engine...
I've installed ruby-1.9.1p378 with RVM on MacOS 10.6 & my list of gems http://pastie.org/785148
Any ideas?
version.body-html:
I'm having the same issue. I try to solve it adding the arel gem to the Gemfile and thats not work for me.
http://localhost:3000/posts/new load correctly but when submiting form this error is shown:

undefined method columns' for #<Hash:0x00000103243f98><br/> app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:47:inblock in create'
app/controllers/posts_controller.rb:46:in create'

It seems not to get the sqlite3 engine...

I've installed ruby-1.9.1p378 with RVM on MacOS 10.6 & my list of gems http://pastie.org/785148

Any ideas?
version.title: [RAILS][3.0pre] undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request

version.body: Pablo: please make sure you're using the latest Ruby 1.9.1 release.
version.body-html: Pablo: please make sure you're using the latest Ruby 1.9.1 release.
version.title: Undefined method `adapter_name' on GET request
